title: Share Mail files with two Mac OS on same computer
content: I would like to share mail files with two Mac OS on same computer, and with other Mac OS versions on another Mac. At present these are Mojave and Catalina on a MacBookPro and Mojave and Sequoia on a Mac mini. Either can be opened in target mode so that the other can access the single common Mail folder on one of them or in an external disk. This won’t work with Apples Mail app because the Mail folder contents aren’t compatible between OS versions. Would all Thunderbird versions have the same Mail data folder contents, or do they also have to change with Mac OS versions?

title: Configurazione account posta su Thunderbird
content: Ho configurato quattro account email, ma uno non funziona. Questo è il link alla pagina che mostra la corretta configurazione: https://www.comune.bologna.it/servizi-informazioni/iperbole-mail Allego le foto della configurazione che ho fatto di Thunderbird. Thunderbird prova a connettersi al server e mostra il messaggio che potete vedere nel fondo della pagina che ho salvato e che allego. Pare che il programma trovi il numero dei messaggi che sono sul server, ma il download non parte in realtà. La versione di Thunderbird è 128.5.2esr (64 bit). title: I can no longer send emails from my Virgin Media email address
content:
In December 2024, Virgin Media advised me that my Virgin Media Mail account may have been locked as a security precaution. I was asked to follow the steps given which unlocked it and so was able to use that address again from the Virgin Website but not from Thunderbird. However, I was then given codes and a new password to re-activate the email address on Thunderbird. After a lot of effort trying with the codes given, I can now view all emails on Thunderbird sent and received from that email address but I still cannot send any emails from Thunderbird. Virgin gave me the following instructions for SMTP settings:

Host name: smtp.virginmedia.com Username: your full Virgin Media email address Password: your Virgin Media email app password SSL encryption: Enabled Port: 465 (this might not be selected automating by enabling SSL, so please check) Authentication: Password

Some of the options for "Connection Security" and "Authentication Method" in the Account Settings tab for the SMTP do not exactly relate to the details given by Virgin. I have tried various combinations of options but to no avail. Can anyone advise me how to get round this problem?
creator: humphreyclarke

title: Inbox problems
content:
I have 128.5.2esr (64-bit) on two different machines.

Both have been experiencing LONG delays sending emails, where the error message is that the email was sent but it couldn't be stored in the sent folder. I have followed instructions to repair that folder but that hasn't had any effect.

This morning this happened again, this time it wouldn't store in either sent or drafts folders. I ran disk checking with no errors reported and no other programs are showing any problems. There is plenty of free disk space, I am only using 407 MB of a 4 TB drive.

I noticed slowness opening a message so went in and did a repair on my inbox. All messages disappeared. Quit TB and restarted, same, no messages. So I did a repair again. The messages reappeared, but most are empty! I don't keep many messages in my inbox, just really critical ones, and now they are all gone.

New emails display correctly.

How can I recover these messages? Some are actually really critical and would take some work to locate as I receive an intense amount of emails and some of the critical ones are months old so would take an enormous amount of time to find in the gmail system.

Please help with suggestions, not only on this but in having TB work without these recurring problems.
creator: hpnpilot

title: Thunderbird 128.5.2esr goes Not Responding minutes after starting on Windows 11
content:
Just upgraded to a new system with Windows 11. Avast Security. Installed Thunderbird 128.5.2esr same as on old system. Migrated old emails using MozBackup. Worked great for a day. New emails, archived a bunch of emails to a local folder...

Next day after about 3-5 minutes Thunderbird shows the Hourglass and is not responding. Eventually will go to a greyed out window. I have to kill it with task manager. I noticed that in Activity Manager three calendars were syncing for a long time. Disabled all calendars.

Task manager shows CPU usage but 0 Network and 0 Disk activity. 3 sub processes but only one has CPU. Resource Manager shows CPU and 72 threads. Resource Manager - Analyze Wait Chain - reports "waiting to finish network I/O."

I've tried Troubleshooting Mode. Still froze during Troubleshooting Mode. I've tried moving a large local folder out of the mail folder entirely. I've tried clearing the startup cache. I've tried clearing the system temp folder.

I have a lot of accounts, saved emails and message filters. So I really don't want to start over again with an empty Thunderbird and reset up accounts.
creator: rvicker

title: Not responding
content: Everytime I start up the computer the email takes 15- 20 mins to start responding normally
